Description: Postcard; printed; photograph showing an Egyptian glass portrait in the Corning Museum of Glass.
Producer name: Published by: Corning Museum of Glass
Curator's comments: Modern card; postally used; postmarked 16th March 2014. The message reads: "Day Six. This trip to Corning comes to an end, and I'm heading back now, with a long stop-over again in Philadelphia airport. It's been a great introduction to the centre of glass studies on the occasion of the David Whitehouse memorial conference, and have now met some of his family here and reassured them that we will honour his legacy by looking after the Siraf records. I've also accepted his slides of Kandahar & rural Afghanistan. And last night had to be tracked down in order to attend a private dinner - word was out that I was last seen in a shop full of boxes of you know what in front of me. I found a series about CMOG too. St John". The sender is referring to postcards in the final two sentences and CMOG is the abbreviation of the Corning Museum of Glass. See also EPH-ME.2494-2496.
Associated names: Associated with: Dr St John Simpson
